paragraphs: Advance your career in the dynamic and challenging world of commercial banking.
Department of Accounting, Economics and Finance
The Norris-Vincent College of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

Competition in the banking industry for knowledgeable professionals is very intense, with ability and experience currently in high demand. Our curriculum is designed in collaboration with our banking partners to provide you with training previously available only through industry programs.

Note:Official scores will be required, if admitted.

Students are welcome to apply for admission regardless of their undergraduate major. The Norris-Vincent College of Business will evaluate applicants on an individual basis who do not meet the overall/cumulative GPA of 3.2 or better.
This graduate-level banking certificate program consists of 12 credit hours. That means you only have to complete four courses to earn your certificate.
*Please see theAcademic Calendarfor B session application availability.
Total credit hours: 12

“The Excellence in Banking Program at Angelo State University allowed me to acquire specialized skills in credit & lending analysis that prepared me to be career-ready right after graduation. I gained invaluable knowledge and even more respect for the principles that Sonora Bank embraces. I loved my time with Sonora Bank so much, I had the privilege of transitioning from an intern to a full-time position as a Credit Underwriter in Boerne, TX. I am proud to be a Ram!”

Michael DeLaughter, Class of 2023

“The Excellence in Banking program has an exceptional curriculum that helped me seamlessly start my career in banking. Obtaining the credit essentials certificate was my favorite part of the program, it provided me with ample knowledge that I was able to use in real time through my internship. My time as an intern at City National Bank was unforgettable. Being able to work for a community bank helped get me involved in the community and build connections with other banking professionals.”

Vanessa Calzada, Class of 2023
